business.headline: Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

New and old income tax regimes explained as ITR filing deadline extendedFor FY 2024-25, the new tax regime is automatically applied to taxpayers. Salaried individuals can still choose the old regime while filing their return, but if you miss the due date and file a belated ITR, it can only be done under the new regime.

Field notes from building a billion-dollar luxury brandDiverse leadership isn't just good business, it's the future blueprint for luxury real estate success. Parisa Seif, Managing Partner at Kleindienst Group, writes

New Income Tax Bill 2025: Will changes in the revised bill impact taxpayers?The updated Bill, presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on August 11, incorporates most of the recommendations made by the Select Committee. It is set to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961.

Sensex, Nifty rebound after falling in early trade; inflation data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex fell over 150 points at the opening bell but swiftly recovered by 9:23 am. The Sensex was trading 10 points higher at 80,614.05, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 12.80 points higher at 24,597.85.

JSW Cement IPO allotment today: Check status online, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for JSW IPO can check their allotment status online through the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the portal of KFin Technologies Limited.
Is it smart to use personal loan to fund your next trip?Most of the rise in holiday loans is from non-metro India. In 2025, 71% of borrowers came from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, up from 68% in 2023.

New Income Tax Bill approved: What's new after withdrawal of earlier draftThe original Income Tax Bill, 2025, was introduced on February 13 to replace the six-decade-old Income Tax Act, 1961. However, last week, the government decided to pull it back, saying the changes suggested by the Select Committee needed to be included in a fresh draft.

ICICI Bank raises minimum balance to Rs 50,000: What RBI governor saidICICI Bank has raised the minimum balance from Rs 10,000 to Rs 50,000. In semi-urban branches, it has gone up from Rs 5,000 to Rs 25,000. In rural branches, the requirement is now Rs 10,000.

Air India to suspend Delhi-Washington direct flights from September 1Despite the halt of the direct Delhi-Washington service, Air India will continue offering one-stop flights to Washington via partner airlines Alaska Airlines, United Airlines, and Delta Air Lines.
Sensex ends 746 points up, Nifty above 24,500; Tata Motors gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 746.29 points to close at 80,604.08, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 221.75 points to end at 24,585.05.

Equity mutual fund inflows soar to record high in July. Check detailsNet flows into equity schemes rose 81% month-on-month to Rs 42,702 crore in July, data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) showed. Overall, assets under management in the mutual fund industry hit a record high at Rs 75.36 lakh crore.

entertainment.headline: KBC 17: First contestant quits at Rs 50 lakh question on Rabindranath TagoreAmitabh Bachchan-hosted show, 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', kicked off on August 11. The first contestant on the hot seat failed to answer the Rs 50 lakh question.

Jolly LLB 3 teaser: Akshay-Arshad's courtroom clash turns into a laugh riot'Jolly LLB 3' teaser featuring Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi is finally out. The film is slated to release in theatres on September 19.

Taylor Swift enters 12th era, announces new album The Life of a ShowgirlPop singer Taylor Swift confirmed her forthcoming 12th album in an Instagram video promoting the Wednesday special episode of boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast 'New Heights'.

Kay Kay Menon says Congress misused his clip, denies role in Vote Chori campaignActor Kay Kay Menon shared a post and denied his involvement in Congress's latest 'Vote Chori' campaign. He claimed that the political party used his clip without permission.

Coolie song Monica gets Monica Bellucci's stamp of approval. Pooja Hegde reactsPooja Hegde's song 'Monica' from the film 'Coolie' directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj has now received praise from Monica Bellucci. The 'Retro' actor called it the biggest compliment ever.
Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce's new podcast promo is pure romance. WatchTravis Kelce's podcast promo with Taylor Swift has left fans excited. The video will out on August 13 (ET).

My heart is full: Nick Jonas reflects on MetLife show, Priyanka says so proudSeveral artists, including Demi Lovato, took the stage with the Jonas Brothers, captivating the audience with their performances. Nick Jonas even shared an emotional note while thanking all for their love.

Coolie mania: Rs 4,500 for 1st show, Rajinikanth fans to cross states to watch filmThe craze for Superstar Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' is unprecedented. The film's first-day first-show tickets are being sold for as high as Rs 4,500 in black in Chennai.

Jennifer Aniston says Friends cast mourned Mathew Perry long before his deathActor Jennifer Aniston revealed the 'Friends' cast had been mourning former co-star Matthew Perry before his death in October 2023. She highlighted his tough battle with addiction and shared that he was healthy and happy before he died.

Actor Saurabh Sachdeva comments on Triptii Dimri's choices after Animal successTriptii Dimri experienced a mixed phase in her acting career with some hits and misses. Her 'Dhadak 2' co-star Saurabh Sachdeva recently reflected on her career choices.

Abhinav Shukla echoes Isha Talwar's claim: Shanoo Sharma told me I lacked sparkActor Abhinav Shukla responded to 'Mirzapur' actor Isha Talwar's post against YRF casting director Shanoo Sharma. Shukla shared that he was told by the casting director that he was good-looking but lacked spark.

Not Ahaan in Saiyaara, Arjun Kapoor did romantic bike wrap with Sonakshi firstAn old scene from Arjun Kapoor's film 'Tevar' has resurfaced on social media. Social media users drew parallels to a strikingly similar moment in the recent hit 'Saiyaara'. In the video, Kapoor can be seen pulling Sonakshi Sinha closer on a bike before driving off.

Fawad Khan–Vaani's Abir Gulaal skips India, to release worldwide on August 29The romantic drama 'Abir Gulaal', starring Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor, is slated for worldwide release on August 29, excluding India. It was earlier scheduled for a release on May 9.

For Rajinikanth's Coolie, Anirudh admits using ChatGPT to overcome creative blockMusic composer Anirudh Ravichander opened up about his experience of working on the songs for Rajinikanth's latest film, 'Coolie'. He revealed in a recent interview that he used artificial intelligence to overcome a creative block.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi: Barkha Bisht's stormy entry to create turmoilThe iconic show Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi has returned with a gripping new season. Actor Barkha Bisht's dramatic entry promises to intensify family conflicts and shake Shanti Niketan.

Jolly LLB 3 poster: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi's fight begins ahead of teaser launchFeaturing Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi, the motion poster of Jolly LLB 3 was released today, ahead of its teaser launch tomorrow (August 12). The upcoming legal comedy-drama is slated for a theatrical release on September 19.

Farah Khan shares cook Dilip earns big from YouTube vlogs: He makes more than usFarah Khan shared that her long-time cook and vlog co-star, Dilip, earns extra for his YouTube appearances, joking that he makes "more than everyone here put together."

War 2 gets U/A 16+ rating, Kiara's bikini scene trimmed, inappropriate gesture cutWar 2 censor details out: The sixth film in YRF's spy universe, starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, was passed with a U/A 16+ rating by the censor board. The film also saw a few cuts and modifications by the makers.

Coolie box office prediction: Tamil cinema's biggest Rs 1,000 crore gamble beginsSuperstar Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' is all set to release in theatres on August 14. The film has all the potential to become the Tamil film industry's first Rs 1,000 crore grosser.

general news.headline: Baloch group gets terror tag. Trump's latest largesse for Pak's Asim MunirWhile the Balochistan Liberation Army has been behind several attacks in Pakistan, particularly targeting its military, what is significant here is the timing of the US announcement.

Kerala woman alleges 9 fake votes added at her address in BJP's lone Thrissur seatA woman in Kerala's Thrissur alleged that nine fake votes were added using her address without her knowledge. CPM claims vacant flats in Poonkunnam were misused for voter list manipulation. Opposition leaders demand a probe into alleged BJP-linked irregularities.

Trump tariffs could worsen India's affordable housing crisis. Here's howDonald Trump's steep tariffs on Indian exports risk inflating construction costs, squeezing developers, and pushing affordable housing further out of reach for millions already struggling in India's overheated property market

Delhi-NCR stares at house help crisis amid exodus of Bengali migrantsThe corporate and IT hubs of Noida and Gurgaon, which house a large working-class population, run on migrant labour. A crackdown against illegal Bangladeshi immihrants and fears of a Bihar-like special intensive revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal has led to a sudden exodus of Bengali migrants. Even as a humanitarian crisis unfolds, Delhi-NCR is staring at a domestic help crisis.

Coolie mania: Rs 4,500 for 1st show, Rajinikanth fans to cross states to watch filmThe craze for Superstar Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' is unprecedented. The film's first-day first-show tickets are being sold for as high as Rs 4,500 in black in Chennai.

Kashmiri Pandit woman's 1990 murder case reopened with JKLF raidsThe State Investigation Agency conducted raids on former JKLF members' residences in Srinagar. The investigation could hold implications for addressing past violence in the region.

Where have Gurugram's gurgling river, green hills gone?Gurugram's rise as a corporate powerhouse has come at the expense of its rivers, wetlands, and the Aravallis that once sustained it. The Sahibi River, the Aravallis, and their forests are now either gone or in a dire state. The city's recurring floods, choking dust, and vanishing green cover are the direct fallout of decades of unchecked, ill-planned "development", which, in effect, have been the reasons for their disappearance.

Can't kick India around: Ex-Pentagon official praises PM's tough stand on US tiesFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin said PM Modi's stance would mark the moment the US learnt it can't kick India around. He criticised Trump's position and warned that Pakistan has lost legitimacy over its nuclear threats.

Idle days, wild rumours: Kohli and Rohit deserve to decide ODI futuresFor all the noise about grey beards and holiday photos, the scoreboard still tells the truest story: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma remain match-winners in one-day cricket. The off-season may fuel idle speculation, but the final call on their ODI futures should rest with the men who've carried Indian cricket on their shoulders.

How Modi outsmarted Trump, avoided photo-op trapUS President Donald Trump's Nobel Peace Prize ambitions have him collecting photos with warring world leaders. Last week, Trump turned "peacemaker" again and got Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev and Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan in a single frame. He's trying the same for Putin and Zelenskyy in Alaska. However, PM Narendra Modi outsmarted Trump and didn't fall into a photo-op trap with Pakistan's Asim Munir in June.

Taylor Swift enters 12th era, announces new album The Life of a ShowgirlPop singer Taylor Swift confirmed her forthcoming 12th album in an Instagram video promoting the Wednesday special episode of boyfriend Travis Kelce's podcast 'New Heights'.

Congress High Command sacked me: Ex-Karnataka Minister vows to expose conspiracyFormer Karnataka minister KN Rajanna said the Congress high command was behind his removal. He hinted at a conspiracy but promised details later. His ouster followed remarks on voter list lapses during Congress rule.

Brothers of Destruction: How the relay team is driving India's athletics revolutionThe Indian sprinting group of Animesh Kujur, Gurindervir Singh, Manikanta Hoblidhar and Amlan Borgohain are breaking each other's records in the race to become the fastest man in India. But when they get together for the 4x100m relay, they become one — the Brothers of Destruction.

Top court asks all states to check, release convicts who've completed sentencesThe Supreme Court directed the Home Secretaries of all States and Union Territories to ascertain if any convict is remaining in prison beyond the period of sentence.

You f***ing immigrant: Teens in Canada harass Indian couple, issue death threatAccording to the couple, the confrontation began when the Indian man confronted the group over damage to his vehicle. The teenagers allegedly responded with insults such as "big nose" and "you f***ing immigrant."

What Pakistan army chief Asim Munir's nuclear threat to India from American soil indicatesIndia vowed not to give in to Pakistan's nuclear blackmail and said it was "regrettable" that the "nuclear sabre-rattling" had come from the soil of a friendly third country

People bathe with soap in Canada lake. Video sparks outrage over pollution concernsKirk Lubimov shared a video on X that shows two couples lathering up and rinsing off in the water that several sections of the internet pointed out is harmful and prohibited.

Tariffs on India's oil buys big blow to Russia, says Trump before talks with PutinDonald Trump, speaking at a White House press conference, said Russia's economy was 'not doing well' and had been 'very well disturbed' by the combined effect of American trade duties.

Mullah Marshal Munir and his maniacal mad-doggingPakistani Army chief Asim Munir's nuclear threats, jihadist rhetoric, and Mercedes-dump truck analogy reveal a dangerous mindset that India's defence planners cannot afford to underestimate.

Sholay@50: How Soorma, Jailor, Dhanno became legendsIn part 4 of our series celebrating Sholay's 50th anniversary, we spotlight the unforgettable minor characters who, despite brief screen time, became cultural icons.

Fake Interpol office busted in Noida, former Trinamool leader used to run itVibhas Chand, a former Trinamool leader, has been caught for running a fake international police station in Noida.

Trump praises Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan just days after demanding his resignation: What changed?Donald Trump has reversed course on Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan, praising him days after demanding his resignation over Chinese business ties, following a meeting the president described as "very interesting."

Nidhhi Agerwal denies using Andhra Pradesh government car for event: Had no roleActor Nidhhi Agerwal clarified her non-involvement in using the Andhra Pradesh government car for an event. She explained that she had no role in it.

sports.headline: Ashwin adds value to CSK, but not at his price tag: S Badrinath makes big claimS Badrinath has claimed that CSK should think about releasing R Ashwin, given his current price tag. Ashwin was bought for 9.75 crore rupees by Chennai during the IPL 2025 mega auction.

Sarfaraz Khan eyeing Sunil Gavaskar's Kanga League script for India comebackSarfaraz Khan is embracing the monsoon grind of Mumbai's Kanga League, following in Sunil Gavaskar's footsteps, to sharpen his game and make a strong case for a Test comeback after his England series omission.

Emma Raducanu, chair umpire have hilarious exchange over crying baby at CincinnatiDuring her Cincinnati Open third-round clash with Aryna Sabalenka, Emma Raducanu was distracted by a crying child, leading to a hilarious exchange with the umpire. Raducanu lost the match against Sabalenka, despite a valiant effort.

R Ashwin breaks silence on IPL trade rumours, asks CSK for clarityR Ashwin has finally lifted the lid on the IPL trade rumours surrounding him ahead of the 2026 season. Ashwin returned to CSK during the 2025 mega auction but had a horrible campaign upon his return to Chennai.

Is Cristiano Ronaldo finally engaged? Georgina Rodriguez's post sparks frenzyCristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodríguez have sparked fresh engagement rumours after her Instagram post with a huge ring. The couple, together since 2016, have yet to confirm the news, though social media speculation has been fuelled by past similar hints.

PSG drop Gianluigi Donnarumma from Super Cup squad as summer exit loomsParis Saint-Germain goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma has been excluded from the squad for the UEFA Super Cup, sending a clear message that his time at the club is nearing its end.

Riyan Parag is the reason: Ex-CSK batter on Sanju Samson trade rumoursBadrinath links Sanju Samson's possible Rajasthan Royals exit to Riyan Parag's captaincy prospects. He also questions whether Samson could fit into CSK's already-set top order if a trade happens, despite being a like-for-like replacement for Dhoni.

How Canada U19 won a 50-over game vs Argentina after batting for five deliveriesCanada Under-19 bowled out Argentina Under-19 for just 23 runs in the 2025 Men's U19 Cricket World Cup Americas Qualifier and then chased down the target in only five deliveries on Sunday (10 August).

Would have told Virat Kohli to retire after England Tests: Ex-India chief selectorFormer India skipper and ex-chairman of selectors Dilip Vengsarkar believes Virat Kohli should have been convinced to postpone his Test retirement until the conclusion of the recent five-match series in England.

World Para Athletics Championships: Mondo tracks to be completed by September 1Preparations for the World Para Athletics Championships are on track, with Mondo surfaces at both competition and training venues set for completion by September 1, as India gears up to host its largest-ever para athletics contingent.

Spanish federation approve request for Barcelona-Villareal match in MiamiBarcelona and Villarreal set to make history with La Liga's first-ever official match abroad, slated for Miami this December. The RFEF have approved La Liga's request and now UEFA will have to give the go-ahead for the match.

Gill in Duleep Trophy sends right message to India teammates: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar hailed Shubman Gill for his willingness to participate in the Duleep Trophy even when he could've taken the back seat and rested, considering the gruelling England tour he was a part of.

Akash Deep lands in trouble days after buying new carIndian fast bowler Akash Deep has been served a notice by the Uttar Pradesh Transport Department for allegedly using a vehicle without a High Security Registration Plate (HSRP).

RCB's Mo Bobat appointed Director of Cricket for The Hundred side London SpiritThe Lord's-based Hundred franchise will retain the name London Spirit despite selling a 49% stake to the Silicon Valley consortium "Tech Titans", with former England performance director Mo Bobat named as the incoming director of cricket.

Rickelton in awe of fiery Kwena Maphaka: Cool to see him stand up to AustraliaSouth Africa wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that it was cool to see fiery Kwena Maphaka to stand up to Australia in the first T20I in Darwin.

Be in the moment: Yuvraj Singh's golden advice for India ahead of Women's World CupWomen's World Cup 2025: Former all-rounder Yuvraj Singh urged the Indian women's team to focus on processes rather than results as they try to deal with the burden of playing a major event at home. Harmanpreet Kaur's side will begin their campaign against Sri Lanka in Bengaluru.

Man City's Jack Grealish set for season-long loan to Everton: ReportManchester City's Jack Grealish is reportedly on the verge of a season-long move to David Moyes' Everton. The English midfielder could be the one that revitalises the attack which underperformed last season.,who

Coman completes Saudi move to Al Nassr from Bayern Munich: ReportsKingsley Coman is set to swap Bayern Munich for Al-Nassr in a 30 million euros deal, joining Cristiano Ronaldo and Sadio Mané in Saudi Arabia's star-studded squad as they chase domestic and continental glory.

Rashid Khan blames early Test return for poor show in Champions Trophy and IPLRashid Khan has said that returning to Test cricket too soon after surgery took a toll on his body. He feels that the decision led to a disappointing Champions Trophy and a below-par IPL 2025 campaign.

Jos Buttler remembers late father with emotional note after playing The HundredJos Buttler has paid tribute to his late father, who passed away a week ago, in a heartfelt post shared on Monday. The England batter uploaded a photograph on Instagram showing the two of them holding the ICC Men's Cricket World Cup trophy from England's 2019 triumph, captioned simply: "Rest in peace Dad, thank you for everything."

Why Crystal Palace lost CAS appeal against UEFA on Europa League demotion?Crystal Palace have lost their appeal to the CAS regarding UEFA's decision to demote them from the Europa League. The London-based club are exploring their legal options as it remains firm on its stance.

National Sports Bill passed in Lok Sabha: What does it mean?The Union Government passed the National Sports Governance Bill and the National Anti-Doping Amendment Bill in the Lok Sabha, amid loud protests from the opposition.

Was Maxwell's sensational catch vs SA legal according to new ICC rules?Glenn Maxwell's jaw-dropping boundary catch against South Africa sparked debate under the ICC's updated fielding laws. Here's how his effort stacked up against the new one-touch rule — and why it was perfectly legal.

Prithvi Shaw went down wrong path and spoilt his career: Rohit Sharma's coachRohit Sharma's childhood coach Dinesh Lad recently recalled Prithvi Shaw's rise to international cricket and said that he went down the wrong path to destroy his career.

South Africa may not reach WTC final 2027, Sri Lanka have better chance: ChopraFormer India cricketer Aakash Chopra said that Sri Lanka have a better chance of reaching the World Test Championship (WTC) final in 2027 than defending champions South Africa. He believes that sub-continent tours will pose a threat to South Africa in this cycle.

India in continuous dialogue phase with IOC about 2036 Olympic bid: Sports MinistryIndia's bid to host the 2036 Olympics is currently in the continuous dialogue phase with the IOC's Future Host Commission. The host selection process is paused as the IOC reassesses future election procedures amid doping concerns.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
